newsitem.title: DENMARK: Danish shares rally after U.S.-inspired tumble.
newsitem.headline: Danish shares rally after U.S.-inspired tumble.

text.p: Danish share prices rallied on Tuesday to close higher than expected after the recent U.S. falls with dealers seeing the distinct prospect of prices holding at current levels for a few days.
"We expected to take a beating after the Easter break but we did not do all that badly. The market recovered a little and we could see prices holding now for a while," one dealer said.

The KFX top-20 index closed 1.88 point or 1.22 percent down at 152.70 having plunged earlier 2.67 percent to 150.46 at its lowest point. The KFX June future fell 3.60 point to 150.50 with 20 contracts each worth 100,000 crowns traded.

Otherwise Topdanmark put on 20 crowns to close at 800 on a better 1996 result than expected and shipper J. Lauritzen finished the day the same amount higher at 750 after finalising the sale of 48 percent of its Danyard shipyard to Malaysia's Penang Shipbuilding Construction.
Overall turnover for the day was 974 million crowns.
